intro: Thymelaea tarton-raira subsp. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved thymelaea, is a flowering plant native to the Cape Region of South Africa. It belongs to the family Thymelaeaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to the Mediterranean climate of its native habitat. Its leaves are narrow and evergreen, contributing to its ornamental value in gardens. It is a rare and specialized species, often found in specific microhabitats within its native range.
